questions.question: What is the sum of the angles in a triangle?
questions.explanation: The sum of the angles in a triangle is 180 degrees.

questions.question: What is the name of a polygon with 4 sides?
questions.explanation: A polygon with 4 sides is called a quadrilateral.

questions.question: What is the name of a polygon with 5 sides?
questions.explanation: A polygon with 5 sides is called a pentagon.

questions.question: What is the name of a polygon with 6 sides?
questions.explanation: A polygon with 6 sides is called a hexagon.

questions.question: What is the name of a polygon with 8 sides?
questions.explanation: A polygon with 8 sides is called an octagon.

questions.question: What is the name of a 3-dimensional shape with 6 faces, all of which are rectangles?
questions.explanation: A 3-dimensional shape with 6 faces, all of which are rectangles, is called a cuboid.

questions.question: What is the name of a 3-dimensional shape with 6 faces, all of which are squares?
questions.explanation: A 3-dimensional shape with 6 faces, all of which are squares, is called a cube.

questions.question: What is the name of a 3-dimensional shape with a circular base and a single vertex?
questions.explanation: A 3-dimensional shape with a circular base and a single vertex is called a cone.

questions.question: What is the name of a 3-dimensional shape with two parallel circular bases?
questions.explanation: A 3-dimensional shape with two parallel circular bases is called a cylinder.

questions.question: What is the name of a 3-dimensional shape with no faces, edges, or vertices?
questions.explanation: A 3-dimensional shape with no faces, edges, or vertices is called a sphere.

questions.question: What is the name of a triangle with all sides of different lengths?
questions.explanation: A triangle with all sides of different lengths is called a scalene triangle.

questions.question: What is the name of a triangle with two sides of equal length?
questions.explanation: A triangle with two sides of equal length is called an isosceles triangle.

questions.question: What is the name of a triangle with all sides of equal length?
questions.explanation: A triangle with all sides of equal length is called an equilateral triangle.

questions.question: What is the name of a quadrilateral with opposite sides parallel and equal in length?
questions.explanation: A quadrilateral with opposite sides parallel and equal in length is called a parallelogram.

questions.question: What is the name of a quadrilateral with all sides equal in length and all angles equal?
questions.explanation: A quadrilateral with all sides equal in length and all angles equal is called a square.

questions.question: What is the name of a quadrilateral with opposite sides equal in length and all angles equal?
questions.explanation: A quadrilateral with opposite sides equal in length and all angles equal is called a rectangle.

questions.question: What is the name of a quadrilateral with only one pair of parallel sides?
questions.explanation: A quadrilateral with only one pair of parallel sides is called a trapezium.

questions.question: What is the name of a quadrilateral with all sides equal in length but no right angles?
questions.explanation: A quadrilateral with all sides equal in length but no right angles is called a rhombus.

questions.question: What is the name of a line segment that joins two points on a circle?
questions.explanation: A line segment that joins two points on a circle is called a chord.

questions.question: What is the name of a line segment that passes through the center of a circle and has its endpoints on the circle?
questions.explanation: A line segment that passes through the center of a circle and has its endpoints on the circle is called a diameter.

questions.question: What is the name of a line segment that joins the center of a circle to any point on the circle?
questions.explanation: A line segment that joins the center of a circle to any point on the circle is called a radius.

questions.question: What is the name of a part of a circle's circumference?
questions.explanation: A part of a circle's circumference is called an arc.

questions.question: What is the name of a region bounded by two radii and an arc of a circle?
questions.explanation: A region bounded by two radii and an arc of a circle is called a sector.

questions.question: What is the name of a region bounded by a chord and an arc of a circle?
questions.explanation: A region bounded by a chord and an arc of a circle is called a segment.

questions.question: What is the name of a straight line that touches a circle at exactly one point?
questions.explanation: A straight line that touches a circle at exactly one point is called a tangent.

questions.question: What is the name of a straight line that intersects a circle at two points?
questions.explanation: A straight line that intersects a circle at two points is called a secant.

questions.question: What is the name of a polygon with 7 sides?
questions.explanation: A polygon with 7 sides is called a heptagon.

questions.question: What is the name of a polygon with 10 sides?
questions.explanation: A polygon with 10 sides is called a decagon.

questions.question: What is the name of a polygon with 12 sides?
questions.explanation: A polygon with 12 sides is called a dodecagon.
